title: Atlantis: Myth or History?
description: Exploring the ancient debate between Aristotle and Krantor on whether Atlantis was just a tale or a historical record, with a focus on Krantor's journey to Egypt to validate its existence.

title: The Lost Pillars of Atlantis
description: A journey into the Egyptian city of Sais, examining the supposed pillars that hold the records of Atlantis, as claimed by the ancient philosopher Krantor.

title: Apocalypse in Ancient Myths
description: Analyzing various myths from around the world that tell similar stories of floods, giants, and celestial gods, hinting at a possible global catastrophe.

title: The Dark Side of Archaeological Dogma
description: Investigating how mainstream archaeology often dismisses controversial theories about ancient civilizations and potential world-ending events.

title: The Younger Dryas Catastrophe
description: Exploring the scientific evidence behind the Younger Dryas event, a real ancient apocalypse that aligns closely with the timeline of Atlantis.

title: Clovis Comet Hypothesis: Earth's Ancient Impact
description: Delving into the theory that a comet impact caused the Younger Dryas apocalypse, examining its effects on Earth's climate and megafauna.

title: Gobekli Tepe: Record of an Apocalypse?
description: Investigating Gobekli Tepe, the world's oldest temple, and its potential link to recording the Younger Dryas event and its aftermath.

title: Denisovans: The Lost Giants?
description: Exploring the possibility that the Denisovans, an ancient human species, were giants, and their connection to myths of giant races wiped out by global cataclysms.

title: Megalithic Mysteries: How Were They Built?
description: Examining the construction of megalithic sites like Gobekli Tepe and their mysterious origins, questioning the technology available to ancient builders.

title: Cyclical Time in Hindu Mythology
description: Exploring the concept of Yuga cycles in Hindu mythology, where time is cyclical and each era ends in a world-resetting event.
